qa_pairs.question: What was the significance of Anatoliy Kinakh's role as First Vice Prime Minister in the first Tymoshenko Government, and how did this relate to the party's activities during the 2002 and 2006 elections?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Anatoliy Kinakh's role as First Vice Prime Minister in the first Tymoshenko Government was significant as it positioned him as a key figure within the Party of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs of Ukraine, which participated in the 2002 parliamentary elections as part of the For United Ukraine alliance. This role likely reinforced the party's political influence and alignment with broader coalition strategies during that period.<cite>[S4][S3]</cite></statement> <statement>During the 2006 elections, the party shifted to the *Our Ukraine* bloc, reflecting evolving political alliances. Kinakh's earlier government role in 2002 may have contributed to the party's strategic positioning, though specific connections between his tenure and the 2006 activities are not explicitly detailed in the provided context.<cite>[S5][S4]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] Party of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs of Ukraine


# Party of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs of Ukraine



The **Party of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs of Ukraine** (Ukrainian: Партія промисловців i підприємців України) is a political party in Ukraine registered in April 2000. [S2] Former Ukrainian Prime Minister Anatoliy Kinakh is one of its most noticeable members. [S3] ## History

At the parliamentary elections on 30 March 2002, the party was part of the For United Ukraine alliance. [S4] Party leader Anatoliy Kinakh was First Vice Prime Minister in the first Tymoshenko Government

At the parliamentary elections on 26 March 2006, the party took part in the new *Our Ukraine* bloc. [S5] At the early parliamentary elections parliamentary on September 30, 2007, party-members participated in the elections on the Party of Regions election-list. [S6] In the 2010 local elections the party won 1 representatives in 3 regional parliaments and 6 in the Lviv Oblast. [S7] The party did not participate in the 2012 parliamentary elections. [S8] And again not in the 2014 Ukrainian parliamentary election. [S9] ## Election results

Supreme Council of Ukraine
| Year | Popular vote | % of popular vote | Overall seats won | Seat change | Government |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 2002 | For United Ukraine bloc | | 6 / 450 | 6 | coalition government |
| 2006 | Our Ukraine bloc | | 0 / 450 | 22 | coalition government |
| 2007 | joined Party of Regions | | | | opposition |
| 2012 | X | | | | |
| 2014 | X | | | | | |
